duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate and supervise all aspects of executing the security contract at the assigned location.
Assign work tasks to Security Professionals and oversee their performance throughout the day.
Be the first direct supervisory contact for shift supervisors or Security Professionals, regarding performance, operations, and department needs.
Conduct interviews and evaluate new employees, delivering on-the-job training and ensuring adherence to post orders and training information.
Oversee all reports, logs, and pass downs generated by the Security Department, ensuring appropriate action is taken for minor incidents.
Identify personnel problems at posts and make recommendations for counseling and disciplinary action, as well as maintaining positive client/security relationships.
Occasionally perform Security Professional type job duties on an as-needed basis but not exceeding more than 50% of time in any given workweek.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent, some college education or business classes desirable, valid state Guard License, background investigation, and drug/alcohol test required, valid Driver’s License and driving experience required.
